s-markdown:
Let's say you have a CSV file `my_file.csv`-
```python name,gender,age 'Mike','M',10 'John','M',20 'Julia','F',15 ```
## 1. Reading `df` from CSV
```python my_df = pd.read_csv('my_file.csv') print(my_df) ''' name gender age 0 Mike M 10 1 John M 20 2 Julia F 15 '''
```
## 2. Writing `df` to a CSV file
```python my_df.to_csv('my_new_file.csv') ```
This will create a new file `my_new_file.csv` containing all the rows from `my_df`.
